bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Miles St. John was born in New York in 1843. He enlisted with the 48th Regiment, New York Infantry in August 1861. He served until September 1865, rising from the rank of private to 2nd lieutenant, before mustering out. Following the war, he married Kate Farrelly. They had five children. St. John died in New York in November 1935.
Palmer, Abraham J. The History of the Forty-Eighth Regiment New York State Volunteers, in the War for the Union. 1861-1865. Brooklyn: Pub. by the Veteran Association of the regiment, 1885.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of a letter from Miles St. John to "Mary," dated November 12, 1864. He discusses the building and completion of winter quarters in Virginia, the recent presidential election, and family news.
